This unprecedented announcement of school closures across the state on March 13th posed unique challenges for our MACS teachers, students and families. Yet, our teachers began connecting with students creatively beginning on March 16th and continues to find innovative ways to teach and connect with them.

With community support, our teachers have been able to maintain a sense of a school community even at a distance. This week is Teacher Appreciation Week and tomorrow is Giving Tuesday. Your generous contribution to Manchester Academic Charter School supports and encourages our teachers to continue to excel in their practice.

For every teacher passionate about education. For every teacher that knows every child can learn. For every teacher that is committed, collaborates and cares. We are thankful for them and we are grateful for your support.

Click the link below to give:

MACS will be collecting school supplies to support Haitian teachers. A parent, who is also a board member will facilitate a week long professional development training and supplies are needed to donate to the Haitian schools. If you are able to donate, please bring items to Recognition Day on Thursday, June 15th. (We will accept before and after, but the last day to donate will be June 19th). If you have any questions, please let us know. Thank you for all of your support.

Items needed are as followed:

Pens (preferably blue ink)
Pencils
Pencil erasers
24 pack crayons
Construction paper
White Chalk
Chalk board erasers
Scissors
First aid kit supplies - band aids, triple antibiotic, wet wipes, etc.
Glue sticks
Math Flash cards
Jump ropes
Soccer balls and ball pumps
Stickers
Beginning reading books in FRENCH or Creole
Non-spiraled/wire notebooks
Monetary donation to purchase school supplies

Our Kindergarten Students Break the Benchmark for 2nd Straight Year

For the second consecutive year at MACS, 100% of MACS Kindergarten students (45 out of 45) made the benchmark for our year-end reading DIBELS (Dynamic Indicators of Basic Early Literacy) assessment.

Also, congratulations to grades 1 through 5 in which the overwhelming majority of the students met their end-of-year benchmark as well!
